item.title: Setting Up Local Redis
item.description: Running Redis locally with Docker Have docker setup and running From a docker compatible command line run: docker pull redis From the same command line run: docker run -p 6379:6379 --name=redis redis:latest this will expose the default port, 6379 and create a container with the name ‘redis’. Edit your .env file’s Redis__ConnectionString= value with: localhost:6379,ssl=false,abortConnect=false Additional Notes A useful tool to view/edit the content of a Redis instance is Redis Desktop Manager.
